title: How to Make Healthy Breakfast Meals

steps.headline: Make your cereal or oatmeal more nutritious.
steps.description: Add variety of different berries, whole cut in half or in slices, for example blueberries and strawberries, slice a banana, or sprinkle some raisins on top. Pour in skimmed or low fat milk instead of high fat alternatives or chocolate milk. Try to eat whole grain cereals rather than high in sugar cereals.

steps.headline: Have at least 1/2 cup of fresh fruit with your breakfast.
steps.description: Papaya, mango, cantaloupe (rock melon), and oranges are popular fruits to eat at breakfast time. Be sure to remove any inedible seeds and peel off any inedible or just unpleasant skin before consuming fruit of any kind.

steps.headline: Toss some vegetables into your pan of eggs.
steps.description: You can create so many varieties of vegetable omelets with peppers, chopped white/green onions, mushrooms, spinach or kale and a whole lot more. After you take the eggs off the burner, sprinkle or layer on cheese slices for additional taste. This is a great idea for Lacto Ovo Vegans.

steps.headline: Drink calcium fortified juices, like orange juice.
steps.description: Choose the 100% juices for kids over the types or brands that look appealing to them.

steps.headline: Limit the pastries.
steps.description: Anything that's sweet and sugary, looks great on the side with coffee drinks, or as a "side dish" doesn't contribute to a healthy breakfast. Remember that most desserts contain empty calories, so instead of choosing a cinnamon roll, eat a bagel or English muffin.

steps.headline: Bake your favorite breakfast pastries at a healthier version on your own, for example: Whole-grain, sugar-free cakes/muffins/granola bars; baked oatmeal with fruit and nuts (a great alternative to regular cooked oatmeal, because you can make ahead and refrigerate it); savory muffins with veggies (carrot, zucchinis, tomatoes... Whatever you like!)
steps.description: and so on. Look for interesting recipes on the internet.

steps.headline: Serve whole meal toast with low fat spread.
steps.description: Skip the jam, jelly or peanut butter and have avocado or low fat cottage cheese on toast.

steps.headline: Fill a small dessert bowl with plain low fat yoghurt and add some fruit you've prepared for consumption.
steps.description: Apple and pear go well with yoghurt, as do Clementines, dates, kiwi fruit and berries. Add dried fruit and nuts if you prefer.

text: Make your cereal or oatmeal more nutritious. Add variety of different berries, whole cut in half or in slices, for example blueberries and strawberries, slice a banana, or sprinkle some raisins on top. Pour in skimmed or low fat milk instead of high fat alternatives or chocolate milk. Try to eat whole grain cereals rather than high in sugar cereals. Have at least 1/2 cup of fresh fruit with your breakfast. Papaya, mango, cantaloupe (rock melon), and oranges are popular fruits to eat at breakfast time. Be sure to remove any inedible seeds and peel off any inedible or just unpleasant skin before consuming fruit of any kind. Toss some vegetables into your pan of eggs. You can create so many varieties of vegetable omelets with peppers, chopped white/green onions, mushrooms, spinach or kale and a whole lot more. After you take the eggs off the burner, sprinkle or layer on cheese slices for additional taste. This is a great idea for Lacto Ovo Vegans. Drink calcium fortified juices, like orange juice. Choose the 100% juices for kids over the types or brands that look appealing to them. Limit the pastries. Anything that's sweet and sugary, looks great on the side with coffee drinks, or as a "side dish" doesn't contribute to a healthy breakfast. Remember that most desserts contain empty calories, so instead of choosing a cinnamon roll, eat a bagel or English muffin. Bake your favorite breakfast pastries at a healthier version on your own, for example: Whole-grain, sugar-free cakes/muffins/granola bars; baked oatmeal with fruit and nuts (a great alternative to regular cooked oatmeal, because you can make ahead and refrigerate it); savory muffins with veggies (carrot, zucchinis, tomatoes... Whatever you like!) and so on. Look for interesting recipes on the internet. Serve whole meal toast with low fat spread. Skip the jam, jelly or peanut butter and have avocado or low fat cottage cheese on toast. Fill a small dessert bowl with plain low fat yoghurt and add some fruit you've prepared for consumption. Apple and pear go well with yoghurt, as do Clementines, dates, kiwi fruit and berries. Add dried fruit and nuts if you prefer.
